definition: same as yangqin 揚琴|扬琴, dulcimer
Mandarin ducks and butterfly (i.e. love birds)/derogatory reference to populist and romantic writing around 1900
Mandarin ducks and butterfly (i.e. love birds) literary school around 1900, criticized as populist and romantic by socialist realists

sentences.english: Butterfly flew closer to her to ask to be his bride.
sentences.chinese: 蝴蝶飛到她跟前要她做他的新娘。

sentences.english: My garden was covered with so many butterflies that I could hardly see the flowers.
sentences.chinese: 我的花園裏飛舞着很多蝴蝶，我幾乎看不見花了。
毛蟲在成年期會變成蝴蝶。

sentences.english: This one was heart-shaped all satiny red with a pink bow on top.
sentences.chinese: 就像一隻粉紅色的蝴蝶停在一朵深紅的玫瑰上面。

sentences.english: A man one day pick up a butterfly pupa .
sentences.chinese: 有一個人無意中找到一個蝴蝶蛹。

sentences.english: Do you like my soul, a dream of a butterfly.
sentences.chinese: 你像我的靈魂，一隻夢的蝴蝶。

sentences.english: When the packages are opened the warmth and light wakes them and they fly out.
sentences.chinese: 包裝打開之後，被暖意和光線催醒的蝴蝶就會飛出來。

sentences.english: I still is that single-wing butterfly.
sentences.chinese: 我依舊是那隻單翼蝴蝶。

sentences.english: Finishing strokes in Swedish massage involve swooping around the body in a butterfly motion.
sentences.chinese: 瑞典按摩整理招涉及身體周圍的蝴蝶飛在議案。

sentences.english: We tie the laces in a bow.
Zhang Meng butterfly I love you, you are my goddess.
sentences.chinese: 我愛你張蒙山蝴蝶，您是我的女神。

sentences.english: Overhead soared Crested Serpent-Eagles and a rainbow load of butterflies in the tree tops.
sentences.chinese: 一道由蝴蝶串成的彩虹就掛在樹梢。

sentences.english: So to not to greedy butterfly, only small bees busy all day.
sentences.chinese: 所以招引不來貪心的蝴蝶，只有小蜜蜂整日的忙碌着。

sentences.english: The butterflies flirted from flower to flower.
sentences.chinese: 蝴蝶在花叢中飛來飛去。
我的夢變成了一隻蝴蝶。

sentences.english: Slowly, it drifted down on the coldly wet ground in the street, like a butterfly at night.
sentences.chinese: 緩緩地，飄落在溼冷的街面上，好像一隻夜晚的蝴蝶。

definition: to flutter/to dance in the breeze
